intro: Miconia charleswrightii, commonly known as the Charleswright's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Belize and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in lowland tropical forests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
